property.name: text
property.value:
This model uses an IMUSensor accessor (requires IMUSensor module) to connect to one of Roozbeh's IMU sensors over a ttyS/COM port (depending on OS).
The sensor will need to be already connected or paired to the specified port.

property.name: text
property.value:
To connect one of the IMUs in Linux systems, follow the following steps:
-Install bluez: > sudo apt-get install bluez
-Check that the system has a bluetooth-enabled device: > hcitool dev example output: Devices: hci0 00:1B:DC:06:9F:29
-Scan for available bluetooth sensors: > hcitool scan example output: Scanning ... EC:FE:7E:10:DE:FF BlueRadios10DEFF
-Modify /etc/bluetooth/rfcomm.conf : # # # RFCOMM configuration file. #
rfcomm0 { # # Automatically bind the device at startup # bind yes;
# # Bluetooth address of the device # device EC:FE:7E:10:DE:FF;
# # RFCOMM channel for the connection # channel 1
# # Description of the connection # comment "Bluetooth device 1"; }
-Create a bluetooth-agent: > bluetooth-agent 1234 & -Connect rfcomm to device: > rfcomm connect hci0 EC:FE:7E:10:DE:FF & -Link ttyS port: > ln -s /dev/rfcomm0 /dev/ttyS40
'40' in above could be any number, so long as the number is currently unused.
